corruption.description: A card game about the Philippines.
corruption.name: Cards Against Corruption

white.text: A way of life, like traffic jams.
Can't live with it, can't live without it.
Duterte riding on the jetski to the West Philippine Sea.
Binay in his boy scout uniform.
A tiara can fund the treatment of 12,000 tuberculosis cases.
Limited Edition Payatas Voyeur Porn Collection.
Ten billion pesos of taxpayers' money.
Isang bote ng pampa-regla galing sa Quiapo.
The 21st Annual Aurora Boulevard Jeepney Drifting Competition.
A sign that says: "Bwal omehe d2".
Mga barker sa mga terminal ng jeep.
DVD ng bagong season ng Forevermore.
Ang mahiwagang amoy sa loob ng MRT.
De La Salsal Spa and Massage.
Foreigners giving the country a bad rep.
Using sampaguita girls to sell weed.
The Kim Henares Sex Scandal DVD Collection.
Snatchers who complain about people buying cheap Android phones.
Mommy Dionesia's very active sex life.
A call center agent with a nosebleed.
A barangay tanod with a whistle.
A chain text message about blessings.
A raffle that you never win.
A talent show mandatory at work.
An auntie who asks "Parang tumaba ka?"
A family reunion with endless singing.
A karaoke microphone that smells like beer.
A UV express driver says "aalis na" but never leaves.
A street food stick of mystery meat.
A restroom with no bidet and no tissue.
A bidet that shoots like a fire hose.
A public CR that charges 20 pesos.
A brownout in the middle of summer.
An electric fan that sounds like a helicopter.
A power bank that's always dead.
A crush who replies after 3 days.
A friend who says "OTW" while still showering.
A Waze route that betrays you.
A flooded street after 10 minutes of rain.
A sidewalk occupied by parked cars.
A government line that starts at 4 A.M.
A stamp that needs another stamp.
A signature that needs another signature.
An application form that needs three different IDs.
A police checkpoint with random questions.
An exchange gift with a 300-peso limit.
A relative asking when you will get married.
A friend inviting you to a "business opportunity."
A seminar that's actually a cult.
A pastor with a private jet.
A politician's tarpaulin at every corner.
A campaign jingle you can't escape.
A senator who can't spell words correctly.
A protagonist who cries in the rain.
A "to be continued" that never ends.
